itemListElement.name: Vegan Aloo Gobi Mutter( Potatoes Cauliflower peas with Indian spices) Dad’s Favorite. Glutenfree Recipe

@graph.name: Vegan Aloo Gobi Mutter( Potatoes Cauliflower peas with Indian spices)
@graph.description: This Vegan Aloo Gobi is my dad's favorite recipe. Easy with Indian spices and a perfect side with any kind of meal. gluten-free soy-free
recipeIngredient: 1 Tablespoon organic canola or safflower oil or mustard oil or any oil with high smoke point
1  green chili chopped or to taste
1/2 teaspoon coriander powder or freshly crushed coriander seeds
2  overflowing cups of cauliflower florets (large florets broken or cut to a medium size)

recipeInstructions.text: In a large pan, add oil and heat at medium.
recipeInstructions.name: In a large pan, add oil and heat at medium.

recipeInstructions.text: When hot add the cumin seeds and mix for half a minute.
recipeInstructions.name: When hot add the cumin seeds and mix for half a minute.

recipeInstructions.text: Add ginger, garlic, asafetida and chopped chili pepper and mix for a minute or until garlic turns golden.
recipeInstructions.name: Add ginger, garlic, asafetida and chopped chili pepper and mix for a minute or until garlic turns golden.

recipeInstructions.text: At this point you can go 2 ways:
recipeInstructions.name: At this point you can go 2 ways:

recipeInstructions.text: 1. Add the coriander, cumin and chili/cayenne powder and mix for a few seconds. Add potatoes and cook covered for 2 minutes. Then add turmeric and cauliflower, mix and continue.
recipeInstructions.name: 1. Add the coriander, cumin and chili/cayenne powder and mix for a few seconds. Add potatoes and cook covered for 2 minutes. Then add turmeric and cauliflower, mix and continue.

recipeInstructions.text: 2. Mix the coriander, cumin, chili/cayenne and turmeric powders in 2 Tablespoons water and add the mix to the pan. Cook for a 1 minute or so until the spices get fragrant and leave oil on the side. Add potatoes, cover and cook for 2 minutes. Add cauliflower florets and cover.
recipeInstructions.name: 2. Mix the coriander, cumin, chili/cayenne and turmeric powders in 2 Tablespoons water and add the mix to the pan. Cook for a 1 minute or so until the spices get fragrant and leave oil on the side. Add potatoes, cover and cook for 2 minutes. Add cauliflower florets and cover.

recipeInstructions.text: Cover and cook potatoes and cauliflower on low heat for 10-15 minutes until the veggies are just about getting tender. Stir every 5 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Cover and cook potatoes and cauliflower on low heat for 10-15 minutes until the veggies are just about getting tender. Stir every 5 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Add salt and peas and a few drops of oil. Mix gently. Cover and cook on low for another 5 or so minutes until veggies are tender to your preference.
recipeInstructions.name: Add salt and peas and a few drops of oil. Mix gently. Cover and cook on low for another 5 or so minutes until veggies are tender to your preference.

recipeInstructions.text: Garnish with fresh Cilantro and serve with any Indian Curry or Daal soup and Roti or Naan flat breads.
recipeInstructions.name: Garnish with fresh Cilantro and serve with any Indian Curry or Daal soup and Roti or Naan flat breads.
